710524f-a.text:
Tenth Ave., south from, but not including West 30th Street. This view is as seen from the pedestrian bridge, at West 30th Street.
May 17, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

710528f-a.text:
Tenth Avenue, south from a point slightly above West 30th Street, showing prominently the pedestrian bridge aver the Avenue at that thoroughfare. This was erected by the New York Central Railroad because of the danger involved by the use of the street bed by their trains. Popularly this was called "Death Avenue". To the left are the milk shed yards.

May 17, 1927

710531f-a.text:
(1)
Tenth Ave., west side, north from, but not including West 30th to, but not including 31st Streets. The view shows the yards of the
N. Y. Central and Hudson River R.R. Company.
May 17, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same
May 17, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Tenth Ave., west side, north from, but not including West 30th to, but not including 31st Streets. The view shows the yards of the

May 17, 1927.

(2)
The same
May 17, 1927.

711979f-a.text:
30th Street, adjoining and west of the north west corner of Tenth Avenue, showing part of the New York Central yards in the right background. In the foreground, crossing the sidewalk, is the boy on horseback who rides ahead of the
engine on Tenth Avenue.
May 17, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

711982f-a.text:
30th Street, north side, east from No. 527 West 30th, between Eleventh and Tenth Avenues.
September 18, 1930
P.L. Sperr

711983f-a.text:
30th Street, east from No. 529 and 526 West 30th, between Eleventh and Tenth Avenues. The bridge at Tenth Avenue runs from the northeast corner to the southwest corner.
September 8, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

711981f-a.text:
Milk sheds and New York Central Station, 30th Street, at, and adjoining the S.E. corner of Tenth Avenue, as seen through
the bridge over the New York Central lines.
May 12, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.

710527f-a.text:
Tenth Ave., west side, (street walk not shown) at West 30th Strcot. On the left appears West 3Oth Street, south side, west from, but not including Tenth Ave. The view shows the yards and tracks of the N. Y. Central and
Hudson R.R. Company.
January 28, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

711976f-a.text:
Clearing at No. 507 West 30th Street, north side, west of
Tenth Avenue.
January 28,1932.
P. L. Sperr.

711978f-a.text:
West 30th Street, north side, west from Tenth Avenue, showing the elevated roadbed carrying the New York Central tracks around this yard. View 2 is photographed
from Eleventh Avenue.
August 25, 1940
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr

711978f-b.text:
West 30th Street, north side, west from Tenth Avenue, showing the elevated roadbed carrying the New York Central tracks around this yard. View 2 is photographed
from Eleventh Avenue.
August 25, 1940
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr

711977f-a.text:
30th Street and 10th Avenue at the southeast corner.
P. L. Sperr  August 25, 1940

710525f-a.text:
(1)
Tenth Ave., at the S.E. corner of West 30th Street. Shown is the 30th Street Station of the N.Y. Central and Hudson River R.R. Co.
May 17, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same site, at a later date, but viewed westward. Site will be used by the U.S. Post Office, for a parcel post station.
April 9, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

710525f-b.text:
(1)
Tenth Ave., at the S.E. corner of West 30th Street. Shown is the 30th Street Station of the N.Y. Central and Hudson River R.R. Co.
May 17, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same site, at a later date, but viewed westward. Site will be used by the U.S. Post Office, for a parcel post station.
April 9, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

710526f-a.text:
343 Tenth Ave., at the S.W. corner of West 30th Street, formerly the Hudson Exchange Hotel. Also shown is a portion of the pedestrian bridge
across "Railroad Ave".
May 17, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

710529f-b.text:
Tenth Avenue, east side, from 30th to 31st Streets, across
railroad clearing on west side.
June 2, 1931.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.
Tenth Avenue, east side, from 30th to 3lst Streets.
July 9, 1932.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.

710529f-a.text:
Tenth Avenue, east side, from 30th to 31st Streets, across
railroad clearing on west side.
June 2, 1931.

711984f-b.text:
(1)
541, 533-529, 527-507 West 30th Street, north side, between Eleventh and Tenth Avenues and towards Tenth.
September 8, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same scene two years later,after demolition of the buildings on 30th Street to make room for the New York
Central elevated roadbed.
In the background behind the Runkel plant, notice the tower
of the Empire State Building.
July 9,1932.
P. L. Sperr.

30th Street, west from and including Tenth Avenue.
